HEY THERE

ALEC ORTEGA
  • ABOUT

It's great to meet you,

I believe that like music, good design is found between the notes. Design should convey just enough to tell the story of a brand while still leaving the rest up to the user’s imagination. When I discovered development I was hooked, now I use code as another medium to craft engaging experiences.

I believe that engagement stems from a user's ability to empathize with a product. It’s never just a product that’s being developed, it’s what it envokes in a user as well. It's with this perspective that I approach both my personal and professional projects.

I'M A: DEVELOPER

I'M A: DESIGNER

Frameworks & Tools

Ruby on Rails

Node.js, Express

Bootstrap, Foundation

Grunt, Bower, Yeoman

Git, GitHub

GSAP, Fabric.js, Paper.js

Clean, Concise

I’m a major proponent of code readability and organization. It’s not just about the if it works or not. Readable, modular code leads to easier maintainability and fewer bugs. Which in the end, is just as important as meeting a deadline.

Knowledge is Power

New and awesome technologies are always being introduced. Learning a new framework, library, or language feels like gaining a super power and after all, every kid grows up wanting to be a superhero. I'm constantly learning not because I need to, but because it's fun.

 VIEW GITHUB

Languages

HTML5, Haml, Jade

CSS3, SASS, SCSS

JavaScript, jQuery

Ruby

Java

Don't Just Tell, Show

There's a difference between neatly displaying information and telling a story. Design elements should come together to create an experience that not only gets the message across but also captures the essence of the product or brand.

  VIEW BEHANCE

All Things Considered

There's more that goes into design than just making it look pretty. Things like production constraints and how the product is actually going to be used need to be taken into consideration. Anyone can make something look nice, I can make it work.

Software

Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign

Sketch 3

Framer.js

Proto.io

Balsamiq

Design for Empathy

No one is going to remember how you made something as much as they are the way that you made them feel afterwards. Design should always be created with the user's perspective and the feeling that you wish to envoke in mind.

Office & Area Guide

DETAILS

Office and Area Guide

MassChallenge

MassChallenge’s move to it’s new office space warranted a design overhaul of many older guides and presentations. I took it upon myself to attempt to transform the older office guide into something that was both informative and engaging. The guide has been offered to tens of thousthat participate in the accelerator as well as various VIP guests and speakers in an attempt to better acclimate them to the space.

Tools Used:

InDesign, Illustrator

Allowance Dashboard

DETAILS

Allowance Dashboard

Personal Project

A concept for a dashboard to manage your kid's allowance and track spending habits for the entire family. This was my first time using Sketch 3 to create a Hi-Fi and is being used as an asset on my personal website.

Tools Used:

Sketch 3, Photoshop

Office & Area Guide

DETAILS

Kitchen Poster

MassChallenge

I was tasked with creating a sign that alerted customers to pay for the items taken from the micro-market in the space. I approached this problem by creating a custom-sized poster in an infographic style to make the information more engaging. I created it in such a way that it remained authoritative enough to deter theft while still maintaining the playfulness of the office space.

Tools Used:

InDesign, Illustrator
